unittitle.altrender: New York State Democratic Committee Records

did.unittitle: New York State Democratic Committee Records

physdesc.extent: 19.01 linear feet ( 27 document boxes, 2 record cartons, 4 photo boxes, 4 oversize flat boxes, 3 scroll boxes).

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

did.abstract: The New York State Democratic Committee (NYSDC) is the official organization of the Democratic Party in the State of New York. The NYSDC adopts and approves changes in the rules that govern party membership, meetings, delegates, conventions, nominations, campaigns, and other functions that take place within the Democratic Party.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The New York State Democratic Committee (NYSDC) is the official organization of the Democratic Party in the State of New York. The NYSDC adopts and approves changes in the rules that govern party membership, meetings, delegates, conventions, nominations, campaigns, and other functions that take place within the Democratic Party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection includes administrative correspondence, photographs, audiovisual recordings, and ephemera that documents the Democratic Party, particularly as it exists in New York State. The bulk of the documentation relates to elections and to the State Committee's administration of the Party, but there are also records relating to national political processes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection is arranged in four series.
Series I: Files, 1980-2006
Subseries I.1: General, 1980-2006
Subseries I.2: Conventions, 1990-2006
Subseries I.3: Delegates and Electoral College, 1991-2004
Subseries I.4: Elections and Campaigns, 1990-2004
Subseries I.5: Judicial, 1988-2006
Subseries I.6: State Committee, 1990-2006
Series II: Audiovisual, 1996-2004
Subseries II.1: Videotapes, 1996-2004
Subseries II.2: Audiotapes, 1998-2002
Subseries II.3: CDs, 2002-2004
Series III: Photographs, 1970-2006
Series IV: Ephemera, 1996-2007
Subseries IV.1: Printed Material, 1996-2007
Subseries IV.2: Realia, 1996-2004

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is located off-site. You will need to request this material at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition
acqinfo.p: New York State Democratic Committee Donation, June 2007.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); New York State Democratic Committee Records; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid written by Elena Locascio in July 2008.
This collection was processed by Elena Locascio, SUNY Geneseo 2011 and Elizabeth Nolte, Columbia University 2009.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the Curator of Manuscripts, Rare Book and Manuscript Library (RBML). The RBML approves permission to publish that which it physically owns; the responsibility to secure copyright permission rests with the patron.

otherfindaid.p: Finding aid in repository; folder level control.

scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of documentation regarding various aspects of the political process in the United States, particularly as it relates to New York State's Democrats.

This subseries is comprised of logistical and statistical information related to the functioning of political parties within the United States and especially within New York State. The folders within this subseries contain information that is not directly related to the State Democratic Committee, but involves members of the Democratic Party or issues that confront it. Many of these folders are related to individual counties in New York State or to financial records kept by the party.

The bulk of the convention files is concerned with New York State Democratic conventions, although there is some information about national conventions for the Democratic and Republican parties. Many of the conventions held between 1990 and 2006 are included in the records of sign-in sheets, hotel plans, proxy forms, correspondence, rules and regulations, and plans for important election years. The state conventions of 1998, 2000, 2002, and 2006 are the most extensively covered.

did.unittitle: Subseries I.3: Delegates and Electoral College, 1991-2004

scopecontent.p: This small subseries includes information regarding delegate selection and the role of the Electoral College in elections. Prominently featured are statements of candidacy, as well as official DNC rules and regulations for selecting delegates.

did.unittitle: Delegate Selection and Affirmative Action Plan, 1991
Certificate of Ascertainment and Certificate of Vote, 2000
DNC Rules and By-Laws and Delegate Selection Plan, 2004

scopecontent.p: A major aim of the New York State Democratic Committee is to elect Democrats into political offices throughout the state. This subseries chronicles recent elections. Extensive coverage is given to the senate election of 2000 between Hillary Rodham Clinton and Rick Lazio and to polling throughout this eight year span. Advertisements and media coverage or relations for other statewide elections, local elections throughout the state, and national elections are also included.

did.unittitle: New York State Board of Elections, 2001
Senate Race 2000 Statement of Support for Hillary Clinton

scopecontent.p: This subseries is almost wholly comprised of information regarding Judicial Nominating Conventions in New York State between 1994 and 2006. Every year between 1997 and 2006 has its own folder, which contains general information about the convention. A party call is also available for every year starting in 1994 and ending in 2005.

The State Committee subseries deals largely with the New York State Democratic Committee’s biannual meetings between 1995 and 2004. The subseries holds more detailed information in regards to scheduling and logistics about the meetings than information about substantive policies and strategy discussed; however, minutes are included in the material corresponding to most meetings.

did.unittitle: Roll Call and Sign-in Sheet, 1999 Spring

scopecontent.p: This series includes video tapes, CDs, and audiotapes that cover a variety of topics related to the New York State Democratic Committee, including events and advertisements.
In this subseries, the State Democratic Convention of May 2002 is covered extensively, as is the New York State Senate race of 2000. Many of the videotapes are campaign advertisements.

scopecontent.p: The eleven audiotapes included in this collection all focus on elections, especially the gubernatorial election of 1998 and the senate election of 2000. Most of the tapes contain advertisements against Republican governor George Pataki.

did.unittitle: "Let’s Find Out," Governor Pataki Running for Second Term, undated

scopecontent.p: The four CDs in the collection, like the audiotapes, appear to be focused on election material.

Most of the events the photographs were taken at seem to have taken place in New York State. Represented in these photographs are notable state and national Democrats, such as the Clintons, Eliot Spitzer, and Al Gore. There are also group shots from state conventions and other events sponsored by the state’s Democratic Committee.

did.unittitle: Clintons, Kerrick, and Port Authority Police Department, 2000s and
Bill Clinton at Ground Breaking, undated (oversize)
Clintons’ Welcome Home after Bush Inauguration, 2001 (oversize)
Cuomo, New York Presidential Forum with George McGovern, Alan Cranston, Ernest Hollings, John Glenn, Gary Hart, Walter Mondale, 1983, undated (oversize)
Fernando Ferrer 1199 SEIU-United Healthcare Workers East, 2005
Fundraiser at Patricia Duff and Ron Perelman’s House, 1995
Gore, Schumer, Rangel, Moynihan at Podium, 2000

scopecontent.p: This series includes banners, posters, bumper sticks, and pins from major elections, including Hillary Clinton’s reelection campaign and the bids that both Gore and Kerry made for the presidency.

Most of the materials in this subseries are stored in oversize Boxes, and are related to major elections. There are also a few posters regarding Democratic conventions. Many of the materials are not dated.

did.unittitle: The Blue Fund: Investing in Change We Can Believe In (oversize)
Craig Johnson: Democrat for State Senate, 2007 (oversize)
New Yorkers for Kerry and Edwards, 2004 (oversize)
Presidential Print Awarded to Clinton by the DNC, 1996 (oversize)

scopecontent.p: The materials in this subseries include buttons, pins, and bumper stickers that show support for the Democratic party as a whole and for specific candidates like Hillary Rodham Clinton, Al Gore, and John Kerry.

did.unittitle: Clinton and Gore and Moynhihan Bumper Stickers
Miriam Haskell Co. pin, Honoring Hillary Rodham Clinton and Tipper Gore, undated
New York State Democratic Committee Flag pin, undated
Victory! New York State Democratic Committee pin, undated
Vote Democrat: McCall, Mehiel, Hevesi, Spitzer button, 2002
